sense.name: fasten with a nail
sense.examples: They nailed up a blanket to cover the hole in the wall. I hope they nailed down all the valuables.

sense.name: succeed decisively at
sense.examples: I agree that Joan Crawford nailed the Crystal character in 1939. She nailed her chemistry exam. Jackson nailed a 3-run homer in the 8th. The movie nailed the feeling of danger but missed the true desperation of the characters.

sense.name: apprehend or expose
sense.examples: They nailed this guy for blackmailing people. Several years later, they nailed the real culprit.

sense.name: pinpoint, establish firmly
sense.examples: They couldn't quite nail down his location. The article nailed the source of the problem. We need to nail down the details at the next meeting. Can DisclosurePolicy help us nail down a blogger code of ethics?

sense.name: copulate with
sense.examples: 'I'd love to nail her,' John leered.
